website_summaries.verdict: Part of an entire curricular series devoted to in-depth academic development.
pros: Lessons focus on development of reasoning, verbal skills, spatial relations, logic, and more
The workbook is sequenced so lessons build upon each other
Kids enjoy working with this book
cons: Although the books are classified by grade, some students may find the lessons too easy
In this case, consider the next level up in the series

customer_reviews.title: Not challenging.
customer_reviews.text: Not great. And not very challenging. Any intelligent 5 year old with reading and writing skills can master it, homeschooled kids particularly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Building Basics
customer_reviews.text: This was one of my absolute favorite book series when I was a kid - the only time I chose to stay up late doing school cause it was fun. I got this book for my daughter, and she is learning a great deal. All the info is basics for dynamic problem solving solutions and global mindset training; and it does that in a fun and straightforward way.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Webber

customer_reviews.title: Great add on for homeschool curriculum!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect book to add to our homeschool curriculum. I will be ordering the next levels in the years to come. My daughter loves doing the work in this book as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: kind of easy for my 7year old she done half of the ...
customer_reviews.text: kind of easy for my 7year old she done half of the book in 2days?? it $30 book, no discount at all...
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K lee

customer_reviews.title: Great Book!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this book for my 7-year-old who was doing very well on standardized tests, but overall did not employ creative thinking skills. This book has taught her to break down problems to find step-by-step solutions and taught her to verbalize what she could already think through but had difficulty putting into words. Best of all, she loves to complete the exercises; she sees the book as a tool that makes learning fun. This book is an excellent tool, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Love this book
customer_reviews.text: I find it very difficult to hold my kid's attention, and I don't want to hold her attention beyond 20 mins or so. This essentially serves the purpose because it is quick to focus on just one or 2 exercise a day. My kids enjoy this so much, that it is a reward to do 1 -2 pages per day!!
customer_reviews.author: BookieMom

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: We’re homeschoolers and I recently purchased this book for my 2nd grader. We do about 3 pages a week and just take our time with them. She really enjoys these so far. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Canales

customer_reviews.title: This book would be better suited to a 1st grader
customer_reviews.text: This book would be better suited to a 1st grader, maybe even Kindergarten. It's all common sense, very little thinking is required- especially for 3rd graders. I was hoping for more puzzles and thinking outside the box or having to work problems out. My 3rd grader breezed through a couple of pages, without even thinking about it. I let my almost first grader try some of pages from different sections, and he breezed through without having to figure things out as well (I was of course reading the directions to him). It's in my Good Will pile now. So disappointing. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Blindfish

customer_reviews.title: Seems good. There's no guide for how you exactly go ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems good. There's no guide for how you exactly go through it... I imagine you just go from front to back at your own pace.
customer_reviews.author: Lowequat

customer_reviews.title: Good for extra challenge
customer_reviews.text: This book is fantastic for kids who need a little extra challenge. My 6 year old would do the entire book, if allowed.
customer_reviews.author: mrslink2

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great book for helping prep your kid for the OLSAT gate test.
customer_reviews.author: Shuree C.

customer_reviews.title: For kids who love workbooks
customer_reviews.text: If your child likes to do workbooks (my four year old can't get enough of them) your child will like this book. I know that the grade level is 2nd or 3rd grade, but it does such a good job of breaking down and explaining concepts that much younger children can benefit from this book too.
customer_reviews.author: imegaphone

customer_reviews.title: Good exercise book to keep a child engaged
customer_reviews.text: If you value the power of the mind, then this book is many many times more valuable than a DVD player or iPod or game console. Either indoors or even for keeping the kids occupied in a car on trips.
customer_reviews.author: abracadabra

customer_reviews.title: great work for the summer
customer_reviews.text: Loved this book - builds critical thinking. I am planning on buying more of these books. Completing this book during the summer helped my son expand his thinking skills.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great resource to help your kids prepare for the test
customer_reviews.author: Sweets3

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd and 1st graders love the skills in this book.
customer_reviews.author: welovetoread

customer_reviews.title: Loved this book
customer_reviews.text: Loved this book. Really my second graders worked through it in a couple of months in preparation for Cogat and scored very well.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Great workbook to challenge bright children
customer_reviews.text: We bought this workbook to help prepare my 2nd grade son for his testing to get into the GATE (Gifted and Talented) program in our school district. My son is very bright and this was a great workbook to challenge him and to practice critical thinking problems.
customer_reviews.author: Packer Fan 99

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My girl love this book and challenge her which I love.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: solid exercises, no fluff,
customer_reviews.text: develop logical thinking! solid exercises, no fluff. my kids loved their books (I ordered 3) I have two 70 percentile 2nd graders and a 99 percentile kinder. all 3 worked through their books and liked it. it was challenging but intriguing, increased in difficulty throughout sets. kids asked for the next book too. i'm thinking about letting the kids take it to school to do when they finish work early.
customer_reviews.author: 3in2yrs

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I got my kid's test scores back from a standardized test and discovered he needed some work with analogies. I discovered this book would develop the type of problem solving and thinking that he doesn't get enough of at school. After sitting down with him for a bit, I discovered he loves doing worksheets. He's in first grade and this book makes him work a little, but I think it's a good starting point if your kid is above average on standardized tests.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Great brain training
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who is starting 2nd grade. It's not very difficult for her so I'm thinking I could have gotten away with level 2. However she was the best reader in 1st grade so maybe my perception is skewed a bit. She loves this book and is especially thrilled with the activities. They are unlike activities in any other educational workbook and it is like a breath of fresh air for her.
customer_reviews.author: HSF

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this book. My only criticism is that the answers in the back of the book are so small...I can hardly read them.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle N. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shape when I received it. It was exactly as how it was explained.
customer_reviews.author: P. Burchett

customer_reviews.title: My children(9 & 6y) loves these puzzles!!
customer_reviews.text: Initially I doubted this product, but the book(both level 1 & 2) gradually tests the children's minds and is worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: gujili

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: This amongst other books helped my daughter get into the GT program. Very good preparatory material.
customer_reviews.author: R. Chawla

customer_reviews.title: Thinking made easy
customer_reviews.text: This book is wonderful! As every adult knows, analyzing a situation can be critical for success. This book, gently coaches young children not at all on what to think, but HOW to think. If you know you have over compensated with your child/children buy this book so they can learn to think and act on their own.
customer_reviews.author: Thea636

customer_reviews.title: incredible book to give your child a edge
customer_reviews.text: used these to aid in cogat prep for my son and daughter when they were 5 years old. I feel it helped them quite a bit there as their non verbal skills scores soared from it but I also feel it's just a great resource to help cognitive skills at that age. Some may be too hard, some of it too easy but it's got quite a bit of material to pick and choose sections from.
customer_reviews.author: Joosby C.

customer_reviews.title: All in one and compact
customer_reviews.text: Very useful when traveling with your kids and you want them to practise. I found it helpful and it piqued my son's interest. Better than watching DVDs in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Learning Aid
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2nd grader and he enjoys the exercises. I find the material well organized and challenging enough for my kid at 2nd grade.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Very good book, I recomend it!! It contains various topics. I started teaching it to my kids 1st and 2nd grade.
customer_reviews.author: EVI FANARA

customer_reviews.title: Decent Book for 2nd Grader
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is in 2nd Grade and this book is her level. The only thing that could make this book more successful is to add some color pages into it. The whole book are black and white prints which is a little boring to little ones.
customer_reviews.author: rdxxs8513

customer_reviews.title: Per my wife's comments this book is fantastic for my 2nd grader to learn and build thinking ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book for my kid and my wife takes the whole pain to teach the concepts in this book to my daughter. Per my wife's comments this book is fantastic for my 2nd grader to learn and build thinking skills.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing series. My daughter is 4.5 years old and loves this book. This book introduces concepts in a series that prepares the child for tougher problems. Great way to improve child's critical and logical thinking!!
customer_reviews.author: Hiru

customer_reviews.title: Great book to build thinking skill
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for my kids. The book title already tells what is inside "building thinking skill". I come back to amazon to buy level 2 and 3 today. Highly reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: K siri

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by her Vision Therapy Optometrist to help with the visual processing issues we were having. We have since purchased the next level and are working through it. Tough stuff, but good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: Cover whole range of subjects so that you know your child strong and weak subjects. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Q. tran

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Great book to work with my 2nd grader on thinking skills
customer_reviews.author: Emily E. Loftis

customer_reviews.title: Haitian sensation learning!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. I have used this book with 3 children and now with our 4th adopted from Haiti. He was used to rote learning and has a hard time with critical thinking skills/problem solving especially as it deals with math. This book has already been influential in helping him think outside the box and have a sense of success at turning his brain on and learning how to learn! I am very happy with this book!
customer_reviews.author: Danelle Kilpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: Good book.. but most examples are pretty repetitive. Variety would have been nice so that kids can think in multiple styles or dimensions
customer_reviews.author: Arun J. Zachariah

customer_reviews.title: Kids will love this
customer_reviews.text: Nice one, great product which will help to gain more knowledge as you finish the book.
customer_reviews.author: Karan

customer_reviews.title: Good interesting exercises, some are quite challenging
customer_reviews.text: My daughter does not enjoy doing these logic puzzles, but the detailed instruction and samples work well. I also bought the CD version, which is almost exactly the same as the book version, a bit of an overkill, my daughter likes the CD better.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to our Homeschool Curriculum...
customer_reviews.text: This adds the critical thinking component that is missing in most curriculum. My son seems to enjoy the 'puzzles', questions and activities. So far, this is a winner! I also ordered the Level 3 for my older children, and they love it too!
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Kellam

customer_reviews.title: Good book, bad condition
customer_reviews.text: The book itsrlf is good and is what I was looking for, but I was highly disappointed with the condition if it. I realize it was "used", but was reportedly in great condition, instead it had all but about 10 pages scribbled and written on. I am having to carefully erase and clean up each page to use it. So 5 stars for book, and 1 star for buying experience.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara P.

customer_reviews.title: Sure, it makes kids think...
customer_reviews.text: I brought it for my first grade kid. He started working through it all his school days and during summer he finished working the entire book. He was so much interested; I brought him the next book. Will definitely recommend this to keep kids busy with work @ home which will keep them thinking while still being fun to do :-)
customer_reviews.author: Sunil Kantharaju

customer_reviews.title: Product is great: expedited shipping is not
customer_reviews.text: Paid extra for expedited shipping AND sent an e-mail requesting quicker shipping (which was never answered!). The book is helpful and is sold by many other sellers: order it elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
